00031 //=============================================================================
00032 // Internal data structures
00033 //=============================================================================
00034 
00035 // Force the structs to be packed...
00036 #ifdef COMPILE_ON_WINDOWS
00037         #pragma pack(push,old_packing,1)
00038         #define _KVI_PACKED
00039 #else 
00040         // this works only on gcc
00041         #ifdef __GNUC__
00042                 #define _KVI_PACKED __attribute__((__packed__))
00043         #else
00044                 #define _KVI_PACKED
00045         #endif
00046 #endif

00048 // Borders...just do not set it to 0
00049 #define KVI_IRCVIEW_HORIZONTAL_BORDER 4
00050 #define KVI_IRCVIEW_VERTICAL_BORDER 4
00051 
00052 //
00053 // The LineChunk structure contains information about
00054 // an attribute change, an icon or a link
00055 //
00056 // type can be one of:
00057 //
00058 //  KVI_TEXT_ICON:
00059 //     the uIconId member is the icon to be shown
00060 //     szPayload contains the text that triggered this icon was triggered by
00061 //  KVI_TEXT_UNICON:
00062 //     the text block after an icon
00063 //  KVI_TEXT_ESCAPE:
00064 //     szPayload contains the encoded escape command
00065 //     colors.fore contains the new text color
00066 //  KVI_TEXT_UNESCAPE:
00067 //     the text block after an escape
00068 //  KVI_TEXT_COLOR:
00069 //     the colors.back and colors.fore members indicate the color change
00070 //  KVI_TEXT_BOLD:
00071 //     toggles the bold flag
00072 //  KVI_TEXT_UNDERLINE:
00073 //     toggles the underline flag
00074 //  KVI_TEXT_REVERSE:
00075 //     inverts the current fore and back colors
00076 //  KVI_TEXT_RESET:
00077 //     resets the color, bold and underline flags
00078 //
00079 
00080 typedef struct _KviIrcViewLineChunk
00081 {
00082         unsigned char  type;                               // chunk type
00083         int            iTextStart;                         // index in the szText string of the beginning of the block
00084         int            iTextLen;                           // length in chars of the block (excluding the terminator)
00085         kvi_wchar_t  * szPayload;                          // KVI_TEXT_ESCAPE attribute command buffer and KVI_TEXT_ICON icon name (non zeroed for other attributes!!!)
00086         kvi_wchar_t  * szSmileId;
00087         struct {
00088         unsigned char back;                        // optional background color for KVI_TEXT_COLOR attribute
00089         unsigned char fore;                        // optional foreground color for KVI_TEXT_COLOR attribute (used also for KVI_TEXT_ESCAPE!!!)
00090         } _KVI_PACKED colors; // anonymous
00091 //      QColor customBack;
00092         QColor customFore;
00093 } /*_KVI_PACKED*/ KviIrcViewLineChunk;
00094 
00095 //
00096 // The wrapped paintable data block
00097 //
00098 
00099 typedef struct _KviIrcViewWrappedBlock
00100 {
00101         KviIrcViewLineChunk     * pChunk;                  // pointer to real line chunk or 0 for word wraps
00102         int                       block_start;             // this is generally different than pAttribute->block_idx!
00103         int                       block_len;               // length if the block in characters
00104         int                       block_width;             // width of the block in pixels
00105 } _KVI_PACKED KviIrcViewWrappedBlock;
00106 
00107 
00108 typedef struct _KviIrcViewLine
00109 {
00110         // this is a text line in the IrcView's memory
00111         unsigned int                 uIndex;               // index of the text line (needed for find and splitting)
00112         QString                      szText;               // data string without color codes nor escapes...
00113         int                          iMsgType;             // type of the line (defines icon and colors)
00114 
00115         // At line instert time the szData text is splitted in parts which
00116         // signal attribute changes (or icons)
00117         unsigned int                 uChunkCount;           // number of allocated chunks
00118         KviIrcViewLineChunk        * pChunks;               // pointer to the allocated structures
00119 
00120         // At paint time the data is re-splitted in drawable chunks which
00121         // are either real data chunks or line wraps.
00122         // The algorightm that does this is lazy and computes it
00123         // only once for a given widget width (iMaxLineWidth)
00124         unsigned int                 uLineWraps;           // number of line wraps (lines - 1)
00125         int                          iMaxLineWidth;        // width that the blocks were calculated for (lazy calculation)
00126         int                          iBlockCount;          // number of allocated paintable blocks
00127         KviIrcViewWrappedBlock     * pBlocks;              // pointer to the re-splitted paintable blocks
00128 
00129         // next and previous line
00130         struct _KviIrcViewLine     * pPrev;
00131         struct _KviIrcViewLine     * pNext;
00132 } KviIrcViewLine;
00133 
00134 typedef struct _KviIrcViewWrappedBlockSelectionInfoTag
00135 {
00136         int selection_type;
00137         int part_1_length;
00138         int part_1_width;
00139         int part_2_length;
00140         int part_2_width;
00141         int part_3_length;
00142         int part_3_width;
00143 } KviIrcViewWrappedBlockSelectionInfo;

00154 
00155 //FIRST LINE (prev_line = 0) <---m_pFirstLine
00156 //LINE
00157 //--------------------SCREEN--
00158 //LINE

00160 //LINE
